alert.note: Alert for Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 12:53PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Johnson County through 130 PM MDT... At 1252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mayoworth, or 9 miles north of Kaycee, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 256 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
